â€¢ Coverage of Past Due: 94% (Yes, they cover 94% of everything past due, even by 1 day).

The Defense: Hyper-Velocity. MELIâ€™s secret weapon is asset duration. The average loan turns over in <6 months. Unlike a bank holding 30-year mortgages, MELI can re-price its entire risk book 2x a year. If macro flashes red, they don't crash. They just stop originating. The risk liquidates itself in quarters, not years.

The Argentina Sovereign Loop ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡· 
The Fear: Another disorderly devaluation wipes out the real value of the loan book. 
The Paradox: Argentina often has the lowest NPLs in the portfolio.
